label: Sign-in and ID for Non-PIV Contractor Employees
quote: Contractor Employees who do not have their PIV cards must sign-in at lobby guard desk, and show a federal, state, or local government-issued photo identification (e.g., driver’s license that meets the requirements of the REAL ID Act of 2005, US passport, US military ID card, Tribal ID, or Permanent Residence card).

label: Visitor Sign-in and ID Requirement
quote: All visitors requesting access to CBP facilities are required to sign-in at designated visitor location, depending on the facility’s resources. Visitors are required to show a federal, state, or local government-issued photo identification (e.g., driver’s license that meets the requirements of the REAL ID Act of 2005, US passport, US military ID card, Tribal ID, or Permanent Residence card), unless otherwise directed by the Facility Security Manager (FSM) or CBP Assistant Technical Representative (ATR).

label: Sign-in and ID for Non-PIV Contractor Employees
quote: Contractor Employees who do not have their PIV cards must sign-in at lobby guard desk, and show a federal, state, or local government-issued photo identification (e.g., driver’s license that meets the requirements of the REAL ID Act of 2005, US passport, US military ID card, Tribal ID, or Permanent Residence card).

label: Visitor Sign-in and ID Requirement
quote: All visitors requesting access to CBP facilities are required to sign-in at designated visitor location, depending on the facility’s resources. Visitors are required to show a federal, state, or local government-issued photo identification (e.g., driver’s license that meets the requirements of the REAL ID Act of 2005, US passport, US military ID card, Tribal ID, or Permanent Residence card), unless otherwise directed by the Facility Security Manager (FSM) or CBP Assistant Technical Representative (ATR).

label: Visitor Escort Requirement
quote: Visitors must be escorted to their intended CBP destination by CBP employees or CBP contractors with a valid CBP-issued PIV card capable of operating the turnstiles. Supplemental access cards cannot be used for escorting purposes without a valid CBP-issued PIV card.

label: Visitor Pass Issuance and Escort Back
quote: Visitor passes will be issued only at designated locations and/or entrances. All visitors are required to pass through screening at the designated entrances. All visitors must be escorted back to the security desk by a CBP employee or CBP contractor.

label: Sensitive Information Disclosure Restriction
quote: The Contractor Employee shall not disclose, orally or in writing, any sensitive information to any person unless authorized in writing by the CO.
